arm_group.description: Tablets, 1 dose on Day 1 before hemodialysis
Tablets, 1 dose on Day 8 after hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of hemodialysis on the pharmacokinetics
      (PK) of JTZ-951 and to evaluate the safety of 2 doses of JTZ-951 in subjects with end-stage
      renal disease (ESRD) receiving hemodialysis

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Hemodialysis on the PK of JTZ-951 in Subjects With End-stage Renal Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects who have ESRD and have been receiving maintenance hemodialysis for at least
             12 weeks prior to the Screening Visit

          -  Body weight (post-dialysis weight) greater than 45.0 kg and a body mass index between
             20.0 and 40.0 kg/m2 (inclusive) at the Screening Visit

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Acute coronary syndrome (e.g., myocardial infarction) within 1 year prior to
             admission

          -  Uncontrolled hypertension at the Screening Visit or Day -1

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open-label, Sequential Crossover Study to Evaluate the Effect of Hemodialysis on the Pharmacokinetics of JTZ-951 in Subjects With End-stage Renal Disease

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax (maximum concentration) of JTZ-951 when administered before and after hemodialysis
tmax (time to reach maximum concentration) of JTZ-951 when administered before and after hemodialysis
AUC (area under the concentration-time curve) of JTZ-951 when administered before and after hemodialysis
t1/2 (elimination half-life) of JTZ-951 when administered before and after hemodialysis

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with adverse events

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
